ResourceHeader.ResourceName: ICON The Far Ultra Violet Imaging Spectrograph Day Limb Images

RevisionEvent.Note: Added DOI. Edited metadata at PIs request. JMW.
Standardized lower case usage in DOI. LFB 20250224

ResourceHeader.Description: The FUV instrument takes 2D images of the Earth’s horizon in the Far ultraviolet. The imager is pointing approximately 90 degrees to the spacecraft motion, similar to looking out of the side window of a car as it drives down the road. Onboard electronics read the CCD detectors 8 times per second and collect the data into radiance profiles every 12 seconds. The calibrated level 1 radiances and Level 1 ancillary spacecraft data are combined in a limb retrieval to produce the level 2.4 O/N2 limb product.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: National Aeronautics and Space Administration; Dr. Andrew W. Stephan; Dr. Thomas Immel

PublicationInfo.Authors: Stephan, A. W., R.R. Meier, S.L. England, S.B. Mende, H.U. Frey, T.J. Immel

InformationURL.Name: The far ultra-violet Imager on the ICON mission
Daytime O/N2 Retrieval Algorithm for the Ionospheric Connection Explorer (ICON)

Parameter.Name: Epoch Time
Parameter.Description: Time corresponding to the center of each observation, in milliseconds since Jan 1 1970.

Parameter.Name: Altitude Grid Used by the Retrieval
Parameter.Description: Altitude grid used by the retrieval, in WGS, as a function of time.

Parameter.Name: Ap Index
Parameter.Description: Value of Ap used in the forward model, as a function of time. These data are from http://www-app3.gfz-potsdam.de/kp_index/. These are the tabulated Kp values from GFZ German Research Centre for Geosciences at the Helmholtz Centre Potsdam.

Parameter.Name: Retrieved Disk Column O/N2
Parameter.Description: Retrieved column O/N2 from the limb data, as a function of time.

Parameter.Name: F10.7 Used in Inversion Process
Parameter.Description: Unscaled value of F10.7 used as an input to the inversion process, as a function of time. These data are from ftp://ftp.seismo.nrcan.gc.ca/spaceweather/solar_flux/fluxtable.txt. These are the solar radio flux values tabulated from the Space Weather Canada which is a part of Natural Resources Canada.

Parameter.Name: Tangent Altitudes of Input Data
Parameter.Description: Tangent altitudes of input data, in km above the WGS-84 geoid, as functions of time.

Parameter.Name: Corrected Input Data for the Long Wave Channel
Parameter.Description: Corrected input data for the long wave channel, in Rayleighs, as functions of tangent altitude and time.

Parameter.Name: Corrected input data for the Short Wave Channel
Parameter.Description: Corrected input data for the short wave channel, in Rayleighs, as functions of tangent altitude and time.

Parameter.Name: Line of Sight Azimuth Angles
Parameter.Description: Line of sight azimuth angles, in degrees, as functions tangent altitude of time.

Parameter.Name: Line of Sight Zenith Angles
Parameter.Description: Line of sight zenith angles, in degrees, as functions tangent altitdue of time.

Parameter.Name: Uncorrected Input Data for the Long Wave Channel
Parameter.Description: Uncorrected input data for the long wave channel, in Rayleighs, as functions of tangent altitude and time.

Parameter.Name: Uncorrected Input Data for the Short Wave Channel
Parameter.Description: Uncorrected input data for the short wave channel, in Rayleighs, as functions of tangent altitude and time.

Parameter.Name: Data Collection Mode
Parameter.Description: Data collection mode of FUV instrument 1 = Dayside science 2 = Nightside science 3 = Calibration 4 = Nadir 5 = Conjugate 6 = Stars 7 = Ram 8 = Off Target 9 = Engineering 13 = Unknown.

Parameter.Name: Number of Iteration Steps
Parameter.Description: *Diagnostic* Number of iteration steps performed before model converged on answer, as a function of time.

Parameter.Name: Latitude of the Retrieval
Parameter.Description: Latitude of the retrieval, defined at 150 km tangent altitude, in WGS.

Parameter.Name: Quality Flag of Data Quality
Parameter.Description: QUALITY_FLAG is an indicator of data quality = 0 = No errors or quality conditions, LVLH 1 = No errors or quality conditions, R-LVLH 2 = Lunar calibration 3 = Insufficient high voltage 4 = Nadir calibration 5 = Zero wind calibration 6 = Bad pointing 7 = S/C attitude slew 8 = Conjugate observation 9 = Stellar calibration 10 = Unreliable background subtracted 17 = unspecified error condition.

Parameter.Name: Limb Retrieval Quality Flag
Parameter.Description: Limb retrieval quality flag, where 0 = no limb inversion, 1 = retrieval nominal, 2 = number of iterations in retrieval algorithm reaches 10 without convergence, 3 = one or more inversion model parameters hits a priori upper or lower limit, 4 = altitude of peak intensity too close to boundary, 5 = standard deviation of one or more variables exceeds expected limit, 6 = Chi-squared value is outside of expected range - either too large or too small, 7 = one or more uncertainties is outside of expected range.

Parameter.Name: Local Solar Time of the Retrieval
Parameter.Description: Local solar time of the retrieval, defined at 150 km tangent altitude, in WGS.

Parameter.Name: Longitude of the Retrieval
Parameter.Description: Longitude of the retrieval, defined at 150 km tangent altitude, in WGS.

Parameter.Name: Model Error Flag
Parameter.Description: *Diagnostic* flag = 0 - nominal, flag(0)= 1 - 20 steps reached without converging, flag(1)=1 model para hit upper or lower limit, flag(2)=1 peak alt is too close to boundary.

Parameter.Name: Retrieved Altitude Profile of Nitrogen Molecules
Parameter.Description: Retrieved altitude profile of N2 from the retrieval, in cm-3, as a function of altitude and time.

Parameter.Name: Retrieved Altitude Profile of Oxygen
Parameter.Description: Retrieved altitude profile of oxygen from the retrieval, in cm-3, as a function of altitude and time.

Parameter.Name: Retrieved Altitude Profile of Oxygen Molecules
Parameter.Description: Retrieved altitude profile of O2 from the retrieval, in cm-3, as a function of altitude and time.

Parameter.Name: Geodetic Altitude (WGS84) of the Spacecraft
Parameter.Description: Geodetic altitude (WGS84) of the spacecraft at the time corresponding to the middle of each FUV image, in kilometers.

Parameter.Name: ICON Spacecraft WGS84 Latitude
Parameter.Description: Geodetic latitude (WGS84) of the spacecraft at the time corresponding to the middle of each FUV image, in degrees.

Parameter.Name: ICON Spacecraft WGS84 Longitude
Parameter.Description: Geodetic longitude (WGS84) of the spacecraft at the time corresponding to the middle of each FUV image, in degrees.

Parameter.Name: Predicted Initial Column O/N2
Parameter.Description: *Diagnostic* Initial column O/N2 used by the limb retrieval, as a function of time.

Parameter.Name: Initial Predicted Altitude Profile of Nitrogen Molecules
Parameter.Description: *Diagnostic* Initial altitude profile of N2 used by the retrieval, in cm-3, as a function of altitude and time.

Parameter.Name: Initial Predicted Altitude Profile of Oxygen
Parameter.Description: *Diagnostic* Initial altitude profile of O used by the retrieval, in cm-3, as a function of altitude and time.

Parameter.Name: Initial Predicted Altitude Profile of Oxygen Molecules
Parameter.Description: *Diagnostic* Initial altitude profile of O2 used by the retrieval, in cm-3, as a function of altitude and time.

Parameter.Name: Predicted Ion Temperature
Parameter.Description: *Diagnostic* Initial altitude profile of temperature used by the retrieval, in K, as a function of altitude and time.

Parameter.Name: Retrieved Qeuv on the Disk
Parameter.Description: *Diagnostic* Effective solar EUV energy flux, mW/m2.

Parameter.Name: Standard Deviation of the Retrieved Nitrogen Molecules
Parameter.Description: 1 standard deviation of the retrieved N2 from the retrieval, as a function of altitude and time. The data product uncertainties are based on the measurement counting statistics and are lower limits because systematic uncertainties, which are expected to be much larger, are not included. The data processing complexity requires a qualitatively new uncertainty approach that must be derived from first principles.

Parameter.Name: Standard Deviation of the Retrieved Oxygen
Parameter.Description: 1 standard deviation of the retrieved O from the retrieval, as a function of altitude and time. The data product uncertainties are based on the measurement counting statistics and are lower limits because systematic uncertainties, which are expected to be much larger, are not included. The data processing complexity requires a qualitatively new uncertainty approach that must be derived from first principles.

Parameter.Name: Standard Deviation of the Retrieved Oxygen Molecules
Parameter.Description: 1 standard deviation of the retrieved O2 from the retrieval, as a function of altitude and time. The data product uncertainties are based on the measurement counting statistics and are lower limits because systematic uncertainties, which are expected to be much larger, are not included. The data processing complexity requires a qualitatively new uncertainty approach that must be derived from first principles.

Parameter.Name: Standard Deviation of the Column O/N2
Parameter.Description: 1 standard deviation of the retrieved O/N2 from the retrieval, as a function of time. The data product uncertainties are based on the measurement counting statistics and are lower limits because systematic uncertainties, which are expected to be much larger, are not included. The data processing complexity requires a qualitatively new uncertainty approach that must be derived from first principles.

Parameter.Name: Standard Deviation of the Ion Temperature
Parameter.Description: 1 standard deviation of the retrieved temperature from the retrieval, as a function of altitude and time. The data product uncertainties are based on the measurement counting statistics and are lower limits because systematic uncertainties, which are expected to be much larger, are not included. The data processing complexity requires a qualitatively new uncertainty approach that must be derived from first principles.

Parameter.Name: Solar Zenith Angle of the Retrieval
Parameter.Description: Solar zenith angle of the retrieval, defined at 150 km tangent altitude, in WGS.

Parameter.Name: Retrieved Altitude Profile of Temperature
Parameter.Description: Retrieved altitude profile of temperature from the retrieval, in K, as a function of altitude and time.

Parameter.Name: UTC Time String
Parameter.Description: UTC time corresponding to the retrieved parameters, in string format, as a function of time, in the format: 2017-05-27/00:00:01.435.

Parameter.Name: Whole Day Retrieval Flags
Parameter.Description: Single flag set for whole day, where 0 = nominal data set, 1 = whole day skipped because no solar zenith angles were within range.
